initial_question.title: CosyVoice2, 调用 FastAPI 的 `inference_zero_shot` 接口后，生成音频的音色变粗了
initial_question.body:
**Describe the bug**
CosyVoice1 是正常的，但是CosyVoice2 生成的音频中，人的音色变粗。prompt 音频和 1 中使用的是一模一样的。

**Expected behavior**
Normal voice quality. 

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04

satisfaction_conditions: Audio output maintains expected voice quality without distortion
Sample rate configuration matches the model's requirements
Audio output maintains consistent quality across different CosyVoice versions
Generated audio maintains proper pitch regardless of input audio sample rate

initial_question.title: modify the output sampling rate to 16000hz
initial_question.body: I tried to modify the output sampling rate to 16000hz, but the audio sounds clunky, how should I correctly output 16000Hz.

satisfaction_conditions: Audio output plays at 16000Hz sampling rate

initial_question.title: how does llm model prosody?
initial_question.body: Which of the LLM inputs, speech_token or embedding, contains prosody information? Isn’t the speech_feat input for flow_matching supposed to carry prosody information? Does the LLM only focus on reconstructing semantic content, while flow_matching handles the reconstruction of prosody and timbre?

satisfaction_conditions: The response must clarify the role of LLM in processing prosody information
The response must define the role of flow_matching in the overall system
The answer must address the distribution of responsibilities between LLM and flow_matching components

initial_question.title: Why there are different configs between cosyvoice.yaml and cosyvoice.fromscratch.yaml
initial_question.body: I found in cosyvoice.yaml , the llm num_blocks is 14, while that config in cosyvoice.fromscratch.yaml Half reduced, it seems that it will get a smaller model from cosyvoice.fromscratch.yaml. Is that means the cosyvoice.fromscratch.yaml is used to train the smaller model while the cosyvoice.yaml is used to train the cosyvoide-base?

satisfaction_conditions: Configuration differences between files must be explained in terms of their intended use cases
Model size differences must be justified by training dataset or model variant requirements

initial_question.title: TypeError: padding() missing 1 required positional argument: 'use_spk_embedding'
initial_question.body:
**Describe the bug**
When running `bash run.sh` in the training recipe (under `examples/libritts/cosyvoice`), I get the following error: 

``` 
TypeError: padding() missing 1 required positional argument: 'use_spk_embedding'
```

satisfaction_conditions: Configuration file must include the 'use_spk_embedding' parameter
Parameter value must match the training mode
Correct embedding type is used based on training mode

initial_question.title: where is the BPE tokenizer model used in CosyVoice
initial_question.body: I read from paper that CosyVocie use BEP to tokenize text inputs. it has a 51886 dict size, but I did not find where to get the BPE model, where can I get it ?

satisfaction_conditions: Tokenizer model must be correctly identified and accessible
Token vocabulary size must match the specified 51866 tokens
Tokenizer source must be compatible with CosyVoice's implementation
Configuration must align with the actual tokenizer implementation

initial_question.title: 如果用WeTextProcessing的话，像 [laughter] 这种特殊符号还可以识别出来吗
initial_question.body: 想问一下：如果用WeTextProcessing的话，像 [laughter] 这种特殊符号还可以识别出来吗？感谢！

satisfaction_conditions: The correct model variant must be used for special symbol processing

initial_question.title: 如很改成 ip运行
initial_question.body: python3 webui.py --port 50000 --model_dir pretrained_models/CosyVoice-300M   如何修改启动的host , 默认是本机访问，如很改成IP 访问

satisfaction_conditions: Web interface must be accessible from remote machines on the local network
Server must accept connections on network interfaces beyond localhost
Original functionality and port specification must be preserved
Configuration method must be available through command-line or startup parameters

initial_question.title: ImportError: cannot import name 'Annotated' from 'pydantic.typing'
initial_question.body:
example.py is copied from official example. 

2024-07-05 16:29:50,876 - modelscope - INFO - PyTorch version 2.0.1+cu118 Found.
2024-07-05 16:29:50,876 - modelscope - INFO - Loading ast index from /root/.cache/modelscope/ast_indexer
2024-07-05 16:29:52,012 - modelscope - INFO - Loading done! Current index file version is 1.15.0, with md5 51af4c199ce0493bf05f6e6a4c460b07 and a total number of 980 components indexed
transformer is not installed, please install it if you want to use related modules

  File "example.py", line 1, in <module>
    from cosyvoice.cli.cosyvoice import CosyVoice
  File "/mnt/bigclass/project/cosyvoice/CosyVoice/cosyvoice/cli/cosyvoice.py", line 18, in <module>

  File "/mnt/bigclass/project/cosyvoice/CosyVoice/cosyvoice/cli/frontend.py", line 23, in <module>

    from pydantic.typing import Annotated
ImportError: cannot import name 'Annotated' from 'pydantic.typing' (/mnt/bigclass/anaconda3/envs/cosyvoice/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic/typing.py)

I update pydantic.typing from 2.7.0 to 2.8.3, still ...
Need I add transformers to requirements.txt?

satisfaction_conditions: The Annotated type must be successfully imported and available for use
Dependencies must be compatible with Python 3.8 environment
